title: "Why is Developing Multi-Dimensional Awareness Important for Human Functionality and Spiritual Unity?"
first_phrase: This text explores the concept of Functional Awareness, which involves understanding and allowing all dimensions to function without resistance. It proposes that humans have multiple natures, including animal, emotional, and thinking, and suggests that awareness can become fixated in one or more dimensions. To liberate awareness and discover one's true self, dimensional interference must cease to exist. The text also discusses the idea of a biological spirituality, where psychology and biology are included in spirituality. In the last 200 tokens, the author explains how the question "Who Am I?" has evolved to "How do we maintain awareness of the underlying unity of Quantum Consciousness?" citing examples from the growth and expansion of Quantum Psychology in the 1990s. The text invokes Nisargadatta Maharaj, a spiritual master who believes that all individuals are already One Consciousness.
content: These dimensions need to BE without interference in order to liberate awareness which might help in the discovery of who you are.4 Stated another way, since Quantum Psychology defines spirituality as the realization that there is only ONE SUBSTANCE, then true spirituality must include everything from emotions to thoughts and from fantasies to the physical bodyâ€”since there is only THAT ONE SUBSTANCE. Actually, as will be discussed later, what we are ultimately looking at is a biological spirituality whereby biology and psychology are included within spirituality, and the underlying unity of THAT ONE SUBSTANCE. WHY MULTI-DIMENSIONAL AWARENESS? In the early 1990s, Quantum Psychology continued to grow and expand through books such as Quantum Consciousness, Volume I, The Tao of Chaos: Quantum Consciousness, Volume II. The question that continued to emerge from workshop participants as "I" traveled throughout the United States and Europe was no longer, "Who Am I?" but rather, "How do we as human beings live our lives and still maintain the awareness of the underlying unity of Quantum Consciousness?"
last_phrase: In conclusion, multi-dimensional awareness is essential for understanding and realizing our true nature as human beings. It involves acknowledging that spirituality encompasses all aspects of human experience, including biology and psychology. By maintaining an awareness of the underlying unity of Quantum Consciousness, we can live our lives fully while still remaining connected to our true nature. To achieve this, we must not only meditate and experience emptiness but also learn how to stabilize that awareness in our everyday lives.
